name: ImageMaths
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
ImageMaths, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.fsl.utils, interface: ImageMaths).

Use FSL fslmaths command to allow mathematical manipulation of images
    `FSL info <http://www.fmrib.ox.ac.uk/fslcourse/lectures/practicals/intro/index.htm#fslutils>`_


    Examples
    --------

    >>> from nipype.interfaces import fsl
    >>> from nipype.testing import anatfile
    >>> maths = fsl.ImageMaths(in_file=anatfile, op_string= '-add 5',
    ...                        out_file='foo_maths.nii')
    >>> maths.cmdline == 'fslmaths %s -add 5 foo_maths.nii' % anatfile
    True

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str' and with values which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. No description provided.

inputs.name: In file2
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. No description provided.

inputs.name: Mask file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Use (following image>0) to mask current image.

inputs.name: Op string
inputs.description: A string. String defining the operation, i. e. -add.

inputs.name: Out data type
inputs.description: 'char' or 'short' or 'int' or 'float' or 'double' or 'input'. Output datatype, one of (char, short, int, float, double, input).

inputs.name: Out file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. No description provided.

inputs.name: Output type
inputs.description: 'nifti' or 'nifti_pair' or 'nifti_gz' or 'nifti_pair_gz'. Fsl output type.

output-files.name: Out file
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. No description provided.
